Package ch.powerunit.extensions.async.lang

Interface WaitResultBuilder1<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of result of the CompletableFuture
    All Superinterfaces:
    WaitResultBuilder2<T>

    public interface WaitResultBuilder1<T>
extends WaitResultBuilder2<T>
    First Step of the builder of CompletableFuture to skip, if necessary, the error.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default WaitResultBuilder2<T> dontIgnoreException​()
      Explicitly indicate that no exception must be ignored.
      default WaitResultBuilder2<T> ignoreException​()
      Ignore any error during execution of the callable.
      WaitResultBuilder2<T> ignoreException​(boolean alsoDontFailWhenNoResultAndException)
      Ignore any error during execution of the callable and define if there are not result and an exception at last operation if this exception must be thrown.

      • Methods inherited from interface ch.powerunit.extensions.async.lang.WaitResultBuilder2

        expecting, expectingAllOf, expectingAnyOf, expectingEqualsTo, expectingNot, expectingNotNull

    • Method Detail

      • ignoreException

        WaitResultBuilder2<T> ignoreException​(boolean alsoDontFailWhenNoResultAndException)
        Ignore any error during execution of the callable and define if there are not result and an exception at last operation if this exception must be thrown.
        Parameters:
        alsoDontFailWhenNoResultAndException - true if the last exception must also be ignored
        Returns:
        the next step of the builder

      • ignoreException

        default WaitResultBuilder2<T> ignoreException​()
        Ignore any error during execution of the callable.
        Returns:
        the next step of the builder

      • dontIgnoreException

        default WaitResultBuilder2<T> dontIgnoreException​()
        Explicitly indicate that no exception must be ignored.

        This this the normal behaviour. This method may be used to make it explicit in the code.

        For example, the following code : 

         WaitResult.of(myCallable).dontIgnoreException().expecting(myPredicate).repeat(2)
                .every(1000, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS).get()
        Throws an AssertionError if myCallable throws an exception.
        Returns:
        the next step of the builder
        Since:
        1.0.0
